div.p: MS 13071 Royal Society of Victoria Exploration Committee records, box 2077/2, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

I herewith hand you two letters to self from Mr Neilson
Letters not found. (who is I believe a relative to Captain Cadell) also a packet of seeds — the letters will repay perusal as he is living at almost the proposed point from which an exploration party
The expedition of which Robert O'Hara Burke was appointed leader on 30 June 1860, and which became known as the Burke & Wills Exploring Expedition, 1860-1. could assemble —
As to his application to join it I have only to say that he is of robust habit about 27 years of age of good character — his letters explain his ability —

MS annotation by M, 10 April 1860: 'Memo forwarded to Dr Macadam | 10/4/60 | Ferd. Mueller'. Neilson was not appointed by Burke to the Expedition party; see M et al. to the Royal Society of Victoria, December 1860 (in this edition as 60-12-00).
